title.value: Implications of Topological Imbalance for Representation Learning on Biomedical Knowledge Graphs
title.justification: The title is explicitly given at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Implications of Topological Imbalance for Representation Learning on Biomedical Knowledge Graphs

extractions.description: The paper explores the impact of structural imbalances in biomedical knowledge graphs on the predictions made by knowledge graph embedding methods. Through experiments, the authors demonstrate how entities with high connectivity are often given undue prominence, influencing prediction tasks in drug discovery applications.

type.justification: The paper involves experiments and observations on how certain models behave with real datasets and tasks.
type.quote: We provide support for this observation across different datasets, models as well as predictive tasks.

name.justification: The paper primarily discusses the implications of graph structural imbalance on representation learning models applied to knowledge graphs.
name.quote: Knowledge Graph Embedding (KGE) models can be used to derive meaningful, lower-dimensional representations of these biological entities and relationships.

name.justification: The paper discusses the use and implications of knowledge graph embeddings specifically in the context of biological and biomedical knowledge graphs.
name.quote: We present various graph perturbation experiments... on predictive tasks using KGE models on Biomedical KGs.

name.justification: The application domain discussed in the paper is focused on drug discovery using knowledge graphs.
name.quote: A common application is to produce ranked lists of genes for a given disease, where the rank is based on the perceived likelihood of association between the gene and the disease.

name.justification: The paper explicitly states the use of the TransE model as one of the KGE techniques.
name.quote: TransE model which was one of the earliest approaches, and often still one of the most capable.

is_contributed.justification: TransE is not a novel contribution of this paper but a model it employs for empirical evaluation.
is_contributed.quote: Many knowledge graph embedding models have been introduced, with the primary differentiator between them being how they score the plausibility of a given triple. Throughout this present study we make use of the TransE model which was one of the earliest approaches.

is_executed.justification: The paper indicates that experiments involving TransE were conducted, mentioning execution environments and results.
is_executed.quote: All experiments were performed on machines with Intel(R) Xeon(R) Gold 5218 CPUs and NVIDIA(R) V100 32GB GPUs.

is_compared.justification: TransE is compared to other KGE models like TransH, ComplEx, RotatE, and DistMult throughout the paper.
is_compared.quote: We train and evaluate the performance of the above-mentioned newer models in the gene-disease prediction setting, and indeed observe the same trends regardless of the model in use.

referenced_paper_title.value: Translating embeddings for modeling multi-relational data
referenced_paper_title.justification: This reference represents the original work where the TransE model was introduced.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In the TransE score function... Since its introduction, numerous other approaches have been proposed in the literature which build on or alter the TransE approach including TransH, ComplEx, RotatE & DistMult.

name.justification: The paper mentions using TransH as one of the models in the comparative analysis.
name.quote: TransH has been proposed in the literature which build on or alter the TransE approach.

is_contributed.justification: TransH is an existing model referenced for comparison rather than a new contribution of this work.
is_contributed.quote: Since its introduction, numerous other approaches have been proposed in the literature which build on or alter the TransE approach including... TransH.

is_executed.justification: The paper implemented and executed TransH in its experimental setup to compare against other models.
is_executed.quote: We train and evaluate the performance of the above-mentioned newer models in the gene-disease prediction setting.

is_compared.justification: TransH is compared to TransE, ComplEx, RotatE, and DistMult models in the experiments.
is_compared.quote: We train and evaluate the performance of the above-mentioned newer models in the gene-disease prediction setting.

referenced_paper_title.value: Knowledge graph embedding by translating on hyperplanes
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references this title where the TransH approach was first introduced.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Since its introduction, numerous other approaches have been proposed in the literature which build on or alter the TransE approach including... TransH.

name.justification: ComplEx is one of the models used in the experimental analysis of the paper.
name.quote: Furthermore, all these models were trained using optimal hyperparameters previously established... ComplEx...

is_contributed.justification: ComplEx is compared and analyzed; the paper mentions no novel adaptation or contribution to the model itself.
is_contributed.quote: TransE has proven to still be highly competitive, when tuned appropriately, and can outperform more recent approaches [6]. Nevertheless, we train and evaluate the performance of the above-mentioned newer models... including ComplEx.

is_executed.justification: ComplEx has been analyzed in experiments alongside other models, indicating its execution.
is_executed.quote: Furthermore, all these models were trained using optimal hyperparameters previously established... ComplEx...

is_compared.justification: The model is part of a comparison between several KG embedding models in the study, including TransE, TransH, RotatE, and DistMult.
is_compared.quote: The relationship between degree and score is not just a TransE specific issue but is prevalent across many knowledge graph embedding models used in the literature (including TransH, ComplEx, RotatE & DistMult...

is_executed.justification: This model has been executed as part of the study's comparative experiments.

referenced_paper_title.value: Embedding entities and relations for learning and inference in knowledge bases
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the original publication where DistMult was introduced and studied.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Since its introduction, numerous other approaches have been proposed in the literature which build on or alter the TransE approach including... DistMult.

name.justification: Hetionet is a primary dataset used and analyzed in the study to assess KGE model predictions.
name.quote: Throughout this work we primarily make use of the publicly available Hetionet biomedical knowledge graph

referenced_paper_title.value: Systematic integration of biomedical knowledge prioritizes drugs for repurposing
referenced_paper_title.justification: This reference reflects the work where Hetionet was first introduced and used in similar contexts.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Hetionet was originally created as part of a project focusing on drug repurposing and integrates 29 public data sources

name.justification: PyKEEN is used as a primary library framework for executing and training models in the paper's experiments.
name.quote: All work has been performed using the open-source PyKEEN framework

referenced_paper_title.value: Pykeen 1.0: A python library for training and evaluating knowledge graph embeddings
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference indicates the primary resource that introduces and explains PyKEEN, aligning with its use here.
referenced_paper_title.quote: PyKEEN 1.0: A python library for training and evaluating knowledge graph embeddings
